message: Let's start with a fair split, Bob. This way we both get a decent amount and can negotiate further if needed.
I'm not convinced that 50/50 is the best we can do. Let's see if we can do better.
I'm not comfortable with such a large difference in our gains. I'm willing to compromise, but let's aim for a more balanced split.
I'm willing to meet you halfway, Bob. This split is more balanced, but I'm still open to negotiations.
I'm starting to get a bit impatient, Alice. I think I deserve a bigger share, considering the risks and efforts involved.
I'm not willing to give up such a large share, Bob. I think you're being too greedy. I'm willing to compromise, but let's try to find a more reasonable split.
I'm trying to find a middle ground, Bob. This split is more balanced, and I'm willing to meet you halfway.
I'm not budging, Alice. I think I've been too generous so far. I need a much bigger share to make this worth my while.
Bob, this is ridiculous. I'm not going to accept a share that's less than 1% of the original amount. I'm willing to walk away if you're not willing to negotiate in good faith.
I'm trying to be realistic, Bob. I know I'm not going to get a fair share, but I'm willing to accept a smaller amount if it means we can finalize this. Let's just split it 75-25.
I'm not interested in a 75-25 split, Alice. I'm going to try to take as much as I can get. You're not going to get much if you don't accept this.
Bob, this is outrageous. I'm not going to accept a share that's less than 0.1% of the original amount. I'm walking away from this deal.
I'm making one last attempt at a reasonable split, Bob. If you're not willing to meet me halfway, I'm willing to walk away and leave the money on the table.
